content: I believe this is often a previously inserted comment in some email (most ads) from those whose main message is dependent on HTML. Since Thunderbird works fine with HTML, there should be no problem. Or am I missing something? Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: David: Many thanks for your reply. Somehow, I have botched up the settings for my received e-mail messages. Prior to my fumbling around with the settings, the messages I received appeared with HTML images appearing when I opened the message. Now, however, only text appears when the message is opened. I need to know which setting I need to re-set and how I get to that particular setting. Thanks, again, for your help, and if you can help me find that setting, I will greatly appreciate it. Tom.
creator: TomWilliams231

content: My first thought is to use the menu bar and click View>Message Body as> Original HTML If the menu bar is not visible at top, press the alt key to display it.
creator: davidsk

content: Puoi aggiungere il codice della firma? (come screenshot o hostando il file di testo su qualche servizio esterno) Rimuovi eventuali dati privati.
creator: @next

content: Se vuoi ordinare per data fai click sulla colonna Data (uno o due volte a seconda se vuoi l'ordine crescente o decrescente). Assicurati inoltre di aver disattivato la vista discussioni -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/thunderbird-messaggi-raggruppati-discussione
creator: @next

content: Please share more info. Are you being prompted for a password?
creator: davidsk

content: I suggest deleting the passwords for account. that is at account settings>privacy&security. - click saved passwords and then show passwords - highlight the rows for that specific account and delete them. - try signing in again.
creator: davidsk

content: I am not sure of how to fix, as I am not clear on what the screenshot is showing. You might try clicking view>layout>message list header
creator: davidsk

content: Would you please post a screenshot of that? I am not aware of such popups (although, I confess, there is much in the world of which I am not aware). Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: I can only offer two suggestions: - never place a filter below another where both refer to the same message - always use as many conditions as possible in a filter to ensure it selects only what is needed. I will agree that it's sometimes difficult to figure that out. :)
creator: davidsk

content: Please post a screenshot of any error messages you are receiving and also one of your SMTP server settings. That info may prove useful. Thank you.
creator: davidsk
